column5: Curtis Richardson from belleville ontario is doing us proud this weekend on the bassmaster northern tour, currently 5 th on day two, he was in second after day one  all so far  with brown ones(smallmouth)  and to boot it looks like his first tourney as a pro according to his bassmaster profile  http://sports.espn.go.com/outdoors/tournam...hesapeakeBay_D1  http://proxy.espn.go.com/outdoors/bassmast...urnamentId=1251

6lbs out of 1st, I think this is all the Canadians great finish Curtis  2 CURTIS RICHARDSON BELLEVILLE, ON 41.6 21,829 0 0 21,829 113 GARRETT GREEN BRACEBRIDGE, ON 3.6 0 0 0 0 127 DAVE ROCHETTE BRACEBRIDGE, ON 2.13 0 0 0 0 144 MIKE SMITH ORONO, ON 1.15 0 0 0 0 148 CHARLES SIM OTTAWA, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 Co-Anglers 14 PETER TYPER PORT COLBORNE, ON 11.10 878 0 0 878 38 BILL WALKER ORANGEVILLE, ON 5.10 165 0 0 165 46 NICOLAS GENDRON SAINTE-BARBE, QC 5.1 165 0 0 165 47 JASON GRAMADA KIRKLAND, QC 5.1 165 0 0 165 98 STEPHEN BARRETT KIRKFIELD, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 PETER LARMAND PORTLAND, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 JEAN CHARLES GOULET BLAINVILLE, QC 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 PIERRE HUGUE LUSSIER CONSTAT, QC 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 JIM WITHINGTON TILLSONBURG, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 JASON BARNUCZ BRANTFORD, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 RYAN JOHNSON INNISFIL, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 BRIAN HALEY BRADFORD, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0 98 PAUL HALL GEORGETOWN, ON 0.0 0 0 0 0
OPPS Sorry Gaspare Constible at 38th on the Boater Side too Richard

Curtis is an awesome young angler , and a really nice guy-you can read his blog on the tournament on WFN, I would also like to congratulate all the Canadians who went out and represented in a very tough tournament!
Good for him, it must be hard to go down there and do well in a tournament but from the looks of things he did very well. Congrads to him, that will be me one day
